greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into distinct parts congruent to 0 or 1 modulo 3.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller and Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000 (first 201 terms from Reinhard Zumkeller)
formula: a(n) ~ exp(Pi*sqrt(2*n)/3) / (2^(19/12) * sqrt(3) * n^(3/4)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 24 2015
mathematica: nmax = 100; CoefficientList[Series[Product[((1+x^(3*k))*(1+x^(3*k-2))), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 24 2015 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 22 2007
